page.title: 08Housing around Mynydd Sylen.
page.content: Houses in this area are sparse.Most are farmhouses built in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.There are council houses in Ponthenry.Along the B4317 road older houses predominate, but newer houses have been built in between.In Pontyates Ger-y-coed estate was built for managerial staff at Cynheidre Colliery,but now it has been taken over for private ownership. The latest development to be completed is Llys-y-Dderwen which is a solar powered sheltered housing complex for the elderly in Ponthenry.This comprises 26 separate dwellings connected to a communal day centre.It is patrolled by a warden.This complex was opened on October 16th 1985.
